result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Nathaniel Krenzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.

STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Nathaniel Krenzke

defendant.name: Krenzke, Shawn Nathaniel
defendant.address: 7825 Old Spring Street, Mount Pleasant, WI 53406

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn N Krenzke in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Shawn N Krenzke.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve SIX MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to 20CM2453, with credit for 37 DAYS time served. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022
  
Serve 20 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME. Report Date: SEPTEMBER 1ST, 2022 BY 5:00PM

No use or possession of alcohol. 

No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

Complete a mental health assessment.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges PAYABLE IN 12 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Shawn Nathaniel Krenzke in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a jury trial. Defense requests to resolve the case through a plea and sentencing.
Court vacates today's jury trial.
Plea hearing proceeded.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court ordered CASE 21CM1312 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 30 for Sentencing. 
This hearing will be held in person.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Shawn Nathaniel Krenzke not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Status conference held. Defendant's appearance is waived. State's Joinder motion addressed on the record. Defense does not object. Court grants State's motion for Joinder. Case now in trial posture. Defense states a final pretrial was not necessary. Case remains calendared in Br. 30.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant was taken into custody.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.V.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shawn Nathaniel Krenzke in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.30 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion to Join for Trial, filed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@1:30p
